WRITING.TEXT: Horrible mentality, it's like they came into the game thinking they'd lose. Weak performance, I'm extremely disappointed. Wow
Needed to be bringing the blitz, has not brought the blitz.
Can we get any more unlucky
Jesus Christ we suck
Reed injured on a cheap shot. You've gotta be kidding.
Might have to turn this one off early
Good start to the second half!! HTTR
Get rid of Hopkins. My god
It's interesting to see how we all praised Ramsey during the Euros (myself included), but he just doesn't perform like that 13/14 season we all think he has in him

Maybe I'm just expecting too much of him too quickly. I think with that price tag I was expecting him to make an impact like Santi does, which I don't think he's done up to this point. He hasn't really been bad per se, but there is definitely room for improvement.

Well I mean it's not like Xhaka has been very good. Gives away possession constantly, commits stupid fouls, doesn't really give us much going forward. I definitely have not been impressed. He was pretty terrible yesterday against the press, and if he's better than Kante technically, then why did he struggle? I don't think Kante was or will be the answer to our problems, but so far Xhaka hasn't been either.
I know I'm going to get downvoted for this but I just haven't been impressed personally.

WRITING.TITLE: Looking Ahead
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]
No one played well. No one cared except for Alexis. I thought the midfield was especially horrible today. Xhaka and Ozil were both anonymous.
Oh no I agree that the attitude is piss poor, but we haven't been able to keep the ball at all this second half and Santi could have helped massively
God damn we need Santi so bad.
Yes please bring on Elneny, because the only thing we need more of is sideways passes
And now Ox is hurt, fucking brilliant
This second half might be the worst we've played this entire year. Utter dogshit.
Feel so bad for him. Great player when he's healthy, just can't seem to catch a break.
That means one of Walcott, Chambo, or Iwobi might be on the way out (might do Iwobi some good going out on loan for a season)
Our defense is going to struggle, but Kirk should have a field day with that secondary. I think if we can control the tempo we will win. Hopkins will need to be able to hit field goals too.
Naivety at its finest...

I don't understand why no changes have been made?! This XI is probably so tired, someone should have come on at around the 60th at the latest.
Update: Giroud looks to be coming on but still
So sluggish, Wenger should have changed up the lineup

When that originally happened I was like "shit there's way too much time on the clock" but my dad was still confident. He turned out to be right, but there always is the chance that we don't end up punching it in considering how bad our red zone offense has been (highly unlikely that we'll end up not getting in with a powerful runner like Kelley on the 1, but you never know). Either way we still got the win and that's all that matters. HTTR
Baffled me that he didn't talk about how Cole used tiller's beat, but I think that score is accurate. It wasn't great and it could have been a lot better, but it's still solid

The thing about him though is that he touches the QB so many times without getting the sack. He needs to turn the corner and take advantage of every time he's in the backfield. For example, the one time he was in the backfield and got to Wentz, wrapped his arms around his leg, and still didn't bring him down.
That was so dirty. Can't believe he's not ejected
Fuck. Every time I think "we gotta let Jackson go" he goes and does this shit. God damnit we need him
Ertz has been wide open on so many routes, but it's not his fault!!
This is the worst defense in the league. Jesus fucking Christ. Fire Barry first and get someone who can teach them tackle.
Beautiful!! Good timing, needed one before halftime. Excellent finish and excellent cross
Lesbians, is titty-sucking 69 a thing?
Reminded me of Child's Play. So corny
Cole really made a song about folding clothes...
I mean Logic usually changes the beats, he doesn't just straight up use the exact same thing like that. Pretty whack.
Using the Exchange beat by Tiller on Deja Vu
Still can't believe we didn't win that
Just because he doesn't look happy doesn't mean he's "going through the motions". You don't score a hat trick by going through the motions
When Ox scored and we were all like "Ok we still have a chance!!" And then they scored like two minutes later lol
Remember when we said this two years ago hahaha

Cech; Gab, Mustafi, Koscielny, Monreal; Coquelin, Xhaka; Walcott, Ozil, Ox; Alexis
Same as Saturday, don't fix it if it ain't broke.

The thing about Desean is that he brings a presence when he plays. Him just being on the field makes us a better team. However, unless he completely goes off for the rest of the season, I highly doubt he'll resign. He costs too much for a team that needs to be pumping their funds into strengthening the defense.

Garcon's contract is gonna be bigger than $5 million. He will probably take a pay cut, but not that big of one. Also, I don't see us taking a RB and a WR back to back to start the draft. I think they'll go with Kelley next year. I think we might pick up a WR in free agency or later in the draft to fill the spot Jackson will leave, but we definitely won't get one that early.

Alexis stole the show, but this was very much a team performance. I think our fullbacks deserve a ton of credit, Monreal put so many good balls into the box, and I don't think Payet got past Gabriel at all.
Xhaka and Coq both played really well. I think we need to go with that pairing. Love Xhaka's passing ability, and paired with Coq's workrates and pace, can prove to be effective. Just worried they'll get themselves sent off at some point.
The Ox was outstanding. Wish he had the confidence to play like this every week. That goal should do wonders for him though.
With Alexis at striker, Ozil doesn't seem to be getting as many assists this year. I think the new style of play Alexis brings is limiting his options for assisting, instead of when Giroud is in and he has an actual target man. I really doubt Ozil is upset with this though because he's the type of player who just wants to win, and he's getting a good goal tally now. Happy that he continues to contribute.

This is really strange, but it seems to be true. For some reason, only one is good at a time. It's like they share confidence between each other and one game one can have it and then they trade it back to the other. Weird.

-Sanchez, just unreal today. Give that man a new contract ASAP. -That goal from the Ox was insane. Love him with confidence. -Monreal was great going forward today. Deserved an assist -Gabriel can serve as a viable RB replacement if necessary. I think we should continue to play him there until Bellerin gets back. -Other than his stupid yellow card, Coq played very well. Growing to like the Xhaka-Coq combination
Bellerin injured, Debuchy injured, and now Gabriel? Is this a joke?
Stats don't show the difference between the two. Kelley is a better runner than Jones.
Alexis and Giroud gay together confirmed
With Gabriel on, I'd like to see us try a 3 at the back if we get up by 2 or 3 goals. Arsene never would but it would be interesting to see.
Of course Debuchy gets hurt, of course. Feel bad for the man, he was actually playing very well today.

You're joking right? Kirk has played some of his best football in the past week. It's not at all his fault we lost today. He can't play defense and kick field goals too. Kirk is our franchise QB and deserves a huge contract this offseason. No debate about it.
Fuck man, why can't our defense tackle
Captain Kirk out here droppin dimes, give that man a contract!

Ok. Wenger, it's time to stop. The Alexis at striker experiment needs to end. It doesn't work. He spent more time played DM today than striker. Giroud MUST be starting. He provides a scoring threat. Alexis needs to be back on the wing.
Elneny was so horrible. He gives us nothing. I don't understand why Xhaka didn't start today. We need creativity, not sideways pass after sideways pass.
Ramsey was horrible today as well, but when moved back into the midfield, he played much much better. Just shows that's where he needs to be playing.
We need Bellerin. Jenko wasn't necessarily bad today, but he doesn't give us anything going forward. It's going to be tough without him.
Overall this was a really bad performance saved by Wenger's subs, so we have to give him credit for that. But the lineup he put out was not creative enough going forward.
Elneny finally coming off, thank god

I'm just confused as to what tactics it would provide, because he's literally doing nothing. I was thinking he'd be on the right to provide defensive relief for Jenko, but he's not even on that side of the pitch. Iwobi needed.

If we want to go for a point, we can stay exactly like we are and maybe bring Xhaka on at around the 70th minute.
But we need to win this game.
Ramsey has been bad today, bring Iwobi on. Ramsey has not been creative enough today. Also, we need Giroud to come on. This Alexis at striker thing has gone pretty badly today. And we need Xhaka instead of Elneny. I'm really not sure why Xhaka didn't start, but Elneny has not been good. He provides no attacking threat and rarely makes a forward pass it seems.
We have no direction in this lineup. Nothing going forward. We're making Phil Jones and Rojo look like Hummels and Boateng. Defensively for us however, I think we've been very good. I can't see United getting a goal if our defense stays as focused as we do.
I have so much respect for him.
We've been good, but we've been lacking the finish. Giroud needed soon to secure the lead.
What a weapon Jordan Reed is.
The tide is turning in the Bengals favor...need a stop
God damn, the Bengals keep tackling high. I'm scared that someone is going to get a concussion.
I agree. I don't see what other people see in him. I think Holding will turn out to be much better.
Not sure how unpopular this is, but I think Gibbs will be starting by the end of the season. Monreal is still a great LB, but he's declining. Gibbs has been solid when he's played this year.
I definitely agree with this. If you look at BPL games, the fans are almost in complete unison. It would be crazy.

My worry is that if we don't sign Cousins to a big, long term deal, then we're back where we were in 2011. Do we draft a new one, or pick up a low end starter from free agency? Whether you like him or not, Cousins is an efficient QB. He just needs to figure out how to get things going early in the season. After the first two games though he's been pretty solid, shaky at times but mostly solid. While I don't think he's worth $20 million, that's what you've gotta pay these days to get a guy like this.

Wow. It looks like Theo's recent success seems to be pushing Ox to perform as well. It will be interesting to see if Theo can control his position as the starting right midfielder or if Ox pushes in front of him. Good strike from him though.
I'm loving how well we've started. It's a joy watching us play again.
Sorry, guess we can't be happy that we're 4-2 and on a 4-game winning streak.

Theo was one of the main reasons I started to support Arsenal. I've been very critical of him lately (I really wanted us to sell him this summer) but he's completely redefined his game. I love his defensive work, and he's playing smart football. I really hope he can keep this form up for the whole season, and hopefully he doesn't get injured. Glad he's doing well again.

I'd like to see Ospina; Bellerin, Mustafi, Kos, Monreal; Cazorla, Xhaka; Walcott, Ozil, Ox; Perez
Keep the back 4 because while it's a team from Bulgaria, they're still a legitimate team and I'd like us to take these games seriously.
Xhaka because he's going to be out next weekend.
Cazorla should be fit because he wasn't with Spain.
Walcott and Ozil for obvious reasons.
I want to see Ox get a start. If he isn't performing bring Iwobi on.
Perez needs a start and we need to rest Alexis. Maybe bring him on if we are in trouble.
I don't understand what having prescription glasses will do to his ability to track motion. Nevertheless, hoping for a speedy recovery
I can't believe we won that game. Defense was outstanding today. Next man up method seems to be working out pretty well.
GET UP JOSH PLEASE
The top 5 guys are arguably the whitest guys on the team haha
12 man ESPN standard Picked up Flacco with Brees on a bye but having second thoughts. Should I got for Wentz or Fitz instead?
Was half of the reason that Pryor scored. Norman was trailing him and Blackmon didn't step in front to stop the ball. Lack of communication between the two.

Making room for Pot Roast
please
I'd be perfectly fine with that. Would Baker go back to DT then?
We need someone we can throw on the d-line who can start and who can stop the run and we need it as soon as possible. I say we look for that and then look to the draft to build depth.

Everyone focuses on the physical battle between the two, and while Norman lost the physical matchup, he beat him down mentally. Playing WR and CB are positions where mindset really matters, and Josh has that mindset.
Being "screwed over" and not getting the results we should have been getting are two very different things.
We've had our fair share of bad calls against us, so it was time we get one in our favor.
Tied with the Browns at half. Fucking disgraceful.
Well we suck. Kinda
Never had a doubt, always rated Ox

We're being outplayed by Burnley at the moment. Cech's distribution has been so poor because they're blocking off passing lanes to the defenders, forcing him to play long balls to players who aren't tall enough to win headers, not to mention his distribution is bad as it is. We look very tired, especially Ozil. I think we need to make some changes. Very happy with Iwobi, Koscielny, and Mustafi so far though.

Good point as well. No injuries is somewhat a win in itself
In my opinion, a win is a win. I'm perfectly ok with us playing shitty as long as we get a win.
Regardless of who the manager will be next season, they'll want world class players like Ozil and Alexis at the club, so no.
Precisely why I think Santi should be paired with Xhaka.
